description.narrative:
(i) Economic growth and job creation: The proposed investment will contribute to the World Bank Group's goals of poverty alleviation by promoting job creation. The Fund will target investments in high-growth companies that are expected to create new employment opportunities by focusing on middle market growth equity investments, which historically have had the largest impact on job creation.
(ii) Access to finance: the Fund will focus on small and midcap companies that need growth capital and seek value adding experienced partners that can help them realize their growth and cross-border expansion plans.
(iii) Private sector development: Given its presence and investment track record across developed and regulated markets, Carlyle has a strong network, a well-recognized brand, and well-designed investment processes, governance, and reporting standards. The proposed investment will allow IFC to promote the use of such private equity best practices across emerging markets, as the growth in these markets requires a robust private equity industry to develop alongside more traditional sources of finance. Carlyle can bring multiple value added capabilities (M&A expertise, international expansion, and management enhancement among others) to help further private sector growth in the region.

The proposed project consists of an equity investment of up to US$25-30 million in the Carlyle Asia Growth Partners V, L.P. (CAGP V or the Fund), a 10-year closed end generalist private equity fund domiciled in the Cayman Islands and managed by an affiliate of The Carlyle Group (Carlyle or the Fund Manager). The Fund targets small buyout and late-stage growth capital investments primarily in China and India and opportunistically in South Korea. The Fund is targeting US$1 billion in commitments. The Fund is expected to make 15 to 20 investments with ticket sizes ranging between US$30million to US$75 million.

participating-org.narrative: CARLYLE ASIA PARTNERS GROWTH I, LP

mailing-address.narrative: The Carlyle Group Mark J. Christopher Managing Director +1 202 729 5626 1001 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW, Washington DC 20004-2505

name.narrative: The Fund will make private equity investments in Asia and will primarily focus on China and India, which are expected to approximately represent 80% of the Funds total invested capital.
